page.title: 13THE HUMBERSTONE
page.content: According to local legend,"Humbeort's" stone(also Holystone or Hellstone) has magical qualities including the power to bring bad luck to those foolish enough to touch it.Although difficult to find, the{Humberstone}can still be seen in a field off Thurmaston Lane. In 1878 excavation revealed the full size of the stone as a roughly oval block some three metres long,two metres deep and two metres across.It is thought to be a glacial erratic deposited as the ice retreated many thousands of years ago.Although the exposed top of the stone has been weathered smooth the buried section retains the angular edges received when it was plucked from the outcrop of Mountsorrel granite.The stone is said to align with St.John's stone (near Leicester Abbey) on Midsummer's day. O.S.Reference:SK 624071(1:50 000)
